title: Cavatelli With Arugula & Ricotta Salata
summary: Cavatelli With Arugula & Ricotta Salata might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains about 22g of protein, 30g of fat, and a total of 718 calories. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.61 per serving. This recipe is liked by 6 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. If you have lemon juice; more, garlic, cavatelli, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 87%. This score is spectacular. Similar recipes are Arugula Salad with Ricotta Salata, Salad of Fennel, Arugula, and Ricotta Salata, and Moroccan Arugula Salad With Beets and Ricotta Salata.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

instructions: In a small bowl, whisk the olive oil, olives, lemon juice, garlic, thyme, black pepper, and cayenne. Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil and cook the cavatelli until al dente. Drain it well and return it to the pan. Add the arugula and the olive-oil mixture, folding gently until the ingredients are combined. Let sit until the arugula has wilted, about 3 minutes. Sprinkle with the ricotta salata just before serving.                  nutrition information (per serving):        Calories                        (kcal):                      800, Fat                        (kcal):                      33, Fat Calories                        (g):                      300, Saturated Fat                        (g):                      11, Protein                        (g):                      24, Monounsaturated Fat                        (g):                      18, Carbohydrates                        (mg):                      99, Polyunsaturated Fat                        (mg):                      3, Sodium                        (g):                      790, Cholesterol                        (g):                      45, Fiber                        (g):                      5,                     Photo: Rita Maas          Rate this Recipe and View Reviews

steps.step: In a small bowl, whisk the olive oil, olives, lemon juice, garlic, thyme, black pepper, and cayenne. Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil and cook the cavatelli until al dente.
Drain it well and return it to the pan.
Add the arugula and the olive-oil mixture, folding gently until the ingredients are combined.
Let sit until the arugula has wilted, about 3 minutes.
Sprinkle with the ricotta salata just before serving.
